Social media users claimed Trump supporters attempted to suppress the vote in
Pennsylvania by falsely telling Clinton supporters they could vote online via a
hashtag.

* Kim LaCapria
     * Published 17 October 2016
   Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Share on Pinterest Share on Reddit
   Share via Email

  Claim

   Pennsylvanians can vote online via social media by using the hashtag
   #PresidentialElection.

Example
   Rumor is that you can vote online between 7 am and 9 pm on Nov. 8th by
   typing "Hillary", on Twitter or Facebook, using the hashtag
   #PresidentialElection.

Collected via e-mail, October 2016

  Rating

   False
   False
   About this rating

  Origin

   In mid-October 2016, an image claiming Pennsylvanians could “vote online”
   during Election Day by using the hashtag #PresidentialElection began
   circulating on social media:

   online voting hashtagonline voting hashtag

   Of course, no hashtag-based online voting mechanism has been implemented
   in Pennsylvania (or anywhere else).
